name: symphonically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to or is similar to a symphony (= a long piece of music for an orchestra, usually with four parts): The opera is symphonically structured and lavishly orchestrated. Tchaikovsky demonstrated how ballet music could be developed symphonically.
in a way that has or relates to a pleasant musical sound: This music is symphonically glorious. Harmonies must be present, and it must all come together symphonically.
More examplesFewer examplesThe material is symphonically developed, but also has the character of a concerto.His fascinating score shows what can be done symphonically with folk melodies.The idea of organizing the piece symphonically was very stimulating.
